data.name: check for winning box in dots and boxes  game
data.description:
dots and boxes is a game played by players taking turns to connect two dots, vertically or horizontally but not diagnolly. When all three lines of a box is linked , the player who 
connects the final link and completes the box earns a point.

At the end when all dots have been connected, the player who completes most boxes wins the game. 

the co-ordinates of the dots are given as:

.(0,0)  .(0,1)  .(0,2)

.(1,0)  .(1,1)  .(1,2)

.(2,0)  .(2,1)  .(2,2)


for the 2 by 2 dots and boxes game :

.    .    .

.    .    .
  
.    .    .

Write a function for 2 by 2 box dots, where already connected links is supplied in argument as array of lines with two end-points co-ordinates. 

Array_of_lines = [line1, line2, line3,.....]

where, 

  line = [one_end_point, another_end_point]

and 

  end_point = [x, y]
  

eg 

[ [ [0,0],[0,1] ], [ [0,1],[0,2] ], [ [1,1],[1,2] ], [ [1,1],[2,1] ], [ [1,2],[2,2] ] ]

has five lines already connected or linked where
[ [0,0],[0,1] ] means the points (0,0) and (0,1) is already linked .


The function will check if there is any place where one line can be connected and box can be
completed hence winning a point and so returns true on finding a first match, or if no match is found returns false.
